page.title: 15STANLEY BURN WALK, PRUDHOE
page.content: Stanley Burn Walk, commonly known as "The Seven Bridges" route, is a most pleasant walk around Prudhoe, rambling among a beautiful setting, following the meander of the burn. To reach this walk you go past Durham Riding and follow a sign over a field and stile into a wood. You will see a great deal of wildlife for instance: fieldmice, rabbits, badgers and owls, and you will see red squirrel dreys. Further along the stream there is a rocky bit of path and a wall of rock known as the " The Grand Canyon". The east branch of the Stanley Burn is regarded as the border between Tyne and Wear and Northumberland.
